pynistview_utils

pynistview_utils contains utility functions for processing data captured by SEMPA. It is also used by the pyNISTview application.

  39def add_colorbar(img, ax, label="", cmap="gray"):
  40    """Add a colorbar
  41
  42    Args:
  43        img (array): Image on which to add colorbar
  44        ax (Axes): Axes for image
  45        label (str, optional): Label. Defaults to ''.
  46        cmap (str, optional): Colormap. Defaults to 'gray'.
  47    """
  48    sm = cm.ScalarMappable(cmap=cmap, norm=plt.Normalize(img.min(), img.max()))
  49    divider = make_axes_locatable(ax)
  50    cax = divider.append_axes("right", size="5%", pad=0.05)
  51    sm.set_array([])
  52    cbar = plt.colorbar(sm, cax=cax, orientation="vertical")
  53    cbar.set_label(label)

  56def adjust_magnetization_ranges(m_1_r_g, m_2_r_g, m_3_r_g, axis_1, axis_2, axis_3):
  57    """Center the magnetization ranges and fit as needed
  58
  59    Args:
  60        m_1_r_g (list): m_1 image data
  61        m_2_r_g (list): m_2 image data
  62        m_3_r_g (list): m_3 image data
  63    """
  64    # Find averages for each image and shift the values
  65    m_1_average = (np.max(m_1_r_g) - np.abs(np.min(m_1_r_g))) / 2
  66    m_2_average = (np.max(m_2_r_g) - np.abs(np.min(m_2_r_g))) / 2
  67    m_3_average = (np.max(m_3_r_g) - np.abs(np.min(m_3_r_g))) / 2
  68
  69    m_1_shifted, m_2_shifted, m_3_shifted = (
  70        m_1_r_g - m_1_average,
  71        m_2_r_g - m_2_average,
  72        m_3_r_g - m_3_average,
  73    )
  74
  75    # Optimize the amount of shift necessary by minimizing least squares fitting
  76    (m_1_offset, m_2_offset, m_3_offset), status, message = find_offsets(m_1_shifted, m_2_shifted, m_3_shifted)
  77
  78    m_1_offset_opt, m_2_offset_opt, m_3_offset_opt = (
  79        m_1_average + m_1_offset,
  80        m_2_average + m_2_offset,
  81        m_3_average + m_3_offset,
  82    )
  83
  84    m_1_adjusted, m_2_adjusted, m_3_adjusted = (
  85        m_1_r_g - m_1_offset_opt,
  86        m_2_r_g - m_2_offset_opt,
  87        m_3_r_g - m_3_offset_opt,
  88    )
  89
  90    m_1_adjusted = m_1_adjusted - fit_image(m_1_adjusted)[0]
  91    m_2_adjusted = m_2_adjusted - fit_image(m_2_adjusted)[0]
  92    m_3_adjusted = m_3_adjusted - fit_image(m_3_adjusted)[0]
  93
  94    print(
  95        "M{} average: {:.4f}, M{} average: {:.4f}, M{} average: {:.4f}".format(
  96            axis_1, m_1_average, axis_2, m_2_average, axis_3, m_3_average
  97        )
  98    )
  99    print(
 100        "M{} offset: {:.4f}, M{} offset: {:.4f}, M{} offset: {:.4f}".format(
 101            axis_1, m_1_offset, axis_2, m_2_offset, axis_3, m_3_offset
 102        )
 103    )
 104
 105    print(
 106        "M{} original range: {:.4f} to {:.4f}; offset range: {:.3f}, {:.4f} to {:.4f}".format(
 107            axis_1,
 108            m_1_r_g.min(),
 109            m_1_r_g.max(),
 110            np.ptp(m_1_adjusted),
 111            m_1_adjusted.min(),
 112            m_1_adjusted.max(),
 113        )
 114    )
 115    print(
 116        "M{} original range: {:.4f} to {:.4f}; offset range: {:.3f}, {:.4f} to {:.4f}".format(
 117            axis_2,
 118            m_2_r_g.min(),
 119            m_2_r_g.max(),
 120            np.ptp(m_2_adjusted),
 121            m_2_adjusted.min(),
 122            m_2_adjusted.max(),
 123        )
 124    )
 125    print(
 126        "M{} original range: {:.4f} to {:.4f}; offset range: {:.3f}, {:.4f} to {:.4f}".format(
 127            axis_3,
 128            m_3_r_g.min(),
 129            m_3_r_g.max(),
 130            np.ptp(m_3_adjusted),
 131            m_3_adjusted.min(),
 132            m_3_adjusted.max(),
 133        )
 134    )
 135
 136    return m_1_adjusted, m_2_adjusted, m_3_adjusted

 139def align_and_scale(
 140    intensity_1,
 141    intensity_2,
 142    m_1,
 143    m_2,
 144    m_3,
 145    m_4,
 146    features=512,
 147    match_percent=0.15,
 148    filter=0.78,
 149):
 150    """Use intensity_1 and intensity_2 (which ideally are identical) to align m_1 - 4
 151
 152    Args:
 153        intensity_1 (array): XY intensity image
 154        intensity_2 (array): XZ intensity image
 155        m_1 (array): XY m_x
 156        m_2 (array): XY m_y
 157        m_3 (array): XZ m_z
 158        m_4 (array): XZ m_x
 159        features (int, optional): Max number of features. Defaults to 512.
 160        match_percent (float, optional): Target percentage for "good" matches. Defaults to 0.15.
 161        filter (float, optional): Not used. Defaults to 0.78.
 162    """
 163    im_1 = rescale_to_8_bit(intensity_1)
 164    im_2 = rescale_to_8_bit(intensity_2)
 165    im_x = rescale_to_8_bit(m_1)
 166    im_y = rescale_to_8_bit(m_2)
 167
 168    # im_1_filtered = np.where(im_1 > int(filter * np.max(im_1)), im_1, 0)
 169    # im_2_filtered = np.where(im_2 > int(filter * np.max(im_2)), im_2, 0)
 170
 171    im_diff = im_2 - im_1
 172
 173    # Detect ORB features and compute descriptors.
 174    orb = cv2.ORB_create(features)
 175
 176    keypoints1, descriptors1 = orb.detectAndCompute(im_1, None)
 177    keypoints2, descriptors2 = orb.detectAndCompute(im_2, None)
 178
 179    # Match features.
 180    # matcher = cv2.DescriptorMatcher_create(cv2.DESCRIPTOR_MATCHER_BRUTEFORCE_HAMMING)
 181    matcher = cv2.BFMatcher(cv2.NORM_HAMMING, crossCheck=True)
 182    # matcher = cv2.BFMatcher(cv2.NORM_L2, crossCheck=True)
 183    matches = matcher.match(descriptors1, descriptors2, None)
 184    matches = list(matches)
 185
 186    # Sort matches by score
 187    matches.sort(key=lambda x: x.distance, reverse=False)
 188
 189    # Remove not so good matches
 190    num_good_matches = np.max([int(len(matches) * match_percent), 4])
 191    print(f"Found {len(matches)} matches; keeping {num_good_matches}.")
 192    matches = matches[:num_good_matches]
 193
 194    # Draw top matches
 195    im_matches = cv2.drawMatches(
 196        im_1,
 197        keypoints1,
 198        im_2,
 199        keypoints2,
 200        matches,
 201        None,
 202        flags=cv2.DrawMatchesFlags_NOT_DRAW_SINGLE_POINTS,
 203    )
 204    im_keypoints = cv2.drawKeypoints(im_1, keypoints1, np.array([]))
 205
 206    # Extract location of good matches
 207    points1 = np.zeros((len(matches), 2), dtype=np.float32)
 208    points2 = np.zeros((len(matches), 2), dtype=np.float32)
 209
 210    for i, match in enumerate(matches):
 211        points1[i, :] = keypoints1[match.queryIdx].pt
 212        points2[i, :] = keypoints2[match.trainIdx].pt
 213    # print(f'{points1}\n{points2}')
 214
 215    # lk_params = {'winSize': (19, 19), 'maxLevel': 2, 'criteria': (cv2.TERM_CRITERIA_COUNT | cv2.TERM_CRITERIA_EPS, 10, 0.03)};
 216
 217    # p2, status, error = cv2.calcOpticalFlowPyrLK(im_1, im_2, points1, points2, **lk_params)
 218    # print(p2, status, error)
 219    # Find homography
 220    h, mask = cv2.findHomography(points1, points2, cv2.RANSAC, ransacReprojThreshold=2.0)
 221    # a_t = cv2.getAffineTransform(points1[:3], points2[:3])
 222    # h = cv2.warpAffine(points1, points2)
 223    # h, mask = cv2.findHomography(points1, np.float32(p2), cv2.RANSAC)
 224    # h = np.array([[9.91469067e-01, -3.06551887e-04,  0],
 225    #               [-1.66912051e-02,  9.97772576e-01,  0],
 226    #               [-8.31626757e-05,  1.28397011e-04,  1.00000000e+00]])
 227
 228    # Use homography
 229    height, width = im_1.shape
 230    intensity_1_h = rescale_to(cv2.warpPerspective(im_1, h, (width, height)), intensity_1)
 231    # intensity_1_h = rescale_to(cv2.warpAffine(
 232    #     im_1, a_t, (width, height)), im_1)
 233    m_1_h = rescale_to(cv2.warpPerspective(im_x, h, (width, height)), m_1)
 234    m_2_h = rescale_to(cv2.warpPerspective(im_y, h, (width, height)), m_2)
 235    plt.figure(figsize=(12, 4))
 236    ax1 = plt.subplot(131)
 237    ax1.imshow(intensity_1, cmap="gray")
 238    ax1.set_title(r'Intensity 1 original')
 239    ax2 = plt.subplot(132)
 240    ax2.imshow(intensity_2, cmap="gray")
 241    ax2.set_title(r'Intensity 2')
 242    ax3 = plt.subplot(133)
 243    ax3.imshow(intensity_1_h, cmap="gray")
 244    ax3.set_title(r'Intensity 1 warped')
 245    
 246    # Figure out translation of homographies
 247    #     first_x_y = (h[0, 2]).astype(int)
 248    #     last_y_x = (np.where(
 249    #         intensity_1_h[-1, h[0, 2].astype(int):] > min(intensity_1_h[-1]))[0][
 250    #                     0] + h[0, 2]).astype(int)
 251
 252    # Find the contour of the image
 253    cnts = cv2.findContours(rescale_to_8_bit(intensity_1_h), cv2.RETR_TREE, cv2.CHAIN_APPROX_SIMPLE)[-2]
 254    # print(f'Found {len(cnts)} contours with shape{np.asarray([0]).shape}:\n{cnts}')
 255    cnts = np.squeeze(cnts[0])
 256    # print(cnts)
 257
 258    # Find the center point of the contour
 259    t_x, t_y = np.mean(cnts[:, 0]), np.mean(cnts[:, 1])
 260    # print(f'Found image center: ({t_x:.1f}, {t_y:.1f})')
 261
 262    # Now measure the distance to each point in the contour from the center for quadrants
 263    # 1 through 4 (top right, top left, bottom left, bottom right, respectively)
 264    # q2 = np.squeeze([point for point in cnts if point[0] < t_x and point[1] < t_y])
 265    q1 = [point for point in cnts if point[0] > t_x and point[1] < t_y]
 266    q2 = [point for point in cnts if point[0] < t_x and point[1] < t_y]
 267    q3 = [point for point in cnts if point[0] < t_x and point[1] > t_y]
 268    q4 = [point for point in cnts if point[0] > t_x and point[1] > t_y]
 269
 270    dists_q1 = [np.sqrt((pt[0] - t_x) ** 2 + (pt[1] - t_y) ** 2) for pt in q1]
 271    dists_q2 = [np.sqrt((pt[0] - t_x) ** 2 + (pt[1] - t_y) ** 2) for pt in q2]
 272    dists_q3 = [np.sqrt((pt[0] - t_x) ** 2 + (pt[1] - t_y) ** 2) for pt in q3]
 273    dists_q4 = [np.sqrt((pt[0] - t_x) ** 2 + (pt[1] - t_y) ** 2) for pt in q4]
 274
 275    # The top left and bottom left points will be the points in the quadrants with the greatest
 276    # distances.
 277    top_left, bottom_left = q2[np.argmax(dists_q2)], q3[np.argmax(dists_q3)]
 278    top_right, bottom_right = q1[np.argmax(dists_q1)], q4[np.argmax(dists_q4)]
 279    print(f"Top left: {top_left}, Top right: {top_right}\nBottom left: {bottom_left}, Bottom right: {bottom_right}")
 280
 281    # x_min = np.max((np.min(bottom_left[0]), np.max(top_left[0])))
 282    # y_min = top_left[1]
 283    # y_max = bottom_left[1]
 284    x_min, x_max = np.max((top_left[0], bottom_left[0])), np.min((top_right[0], bottom_right[0]))
 285    y_min, y_max = np.max((top_left[1], top_right[1])), np.min((bottom_right[1], bottom_right[1]))
 286    print(f"Cropping ({x_min}, {y_min}) to ({x_max}, {y_max})")
 287
 288    # Crop the original images so they all cover the same area
 289    results_r = [img[y_min:y_max, x_min:x_max] for img in (intensity_1_h, intensity_2, m_1_h, m_2_h, m_3, m_4)]
 290    results_h = (intensity_1_h, m_1_h, m_2_h)
 291
 292    return results_r, results_h, h, im_matches, im_keypoints

 295def calculate_distance(x1, x2):
 296    """Calculate the distance between two points"""
 297    return np.sqrt((x1[0] - x2[0]) ** 2 + (x1[1] - x2[1]) ** 2)
 298

 300def calculate_winding_number(x, y, z, xy_s=None, contour=None, wider_contour=True):
 301    """Calculate the winding number"""
 302
 303    # n = 1/4pi int(M dot (dM/dx cross dMdy) dxdy)
 304    # Requires that M be normalized at all points
 305    M = np.array(normalize_3d(x[xy_s], y[xy_s], z[xy_s]))
 306
 307    dmdx, dmdy = np.gradient(M, axis=(2, 1))
 308
 309    if contour is not None:
 310        _, _, width, height = cv2.boundingRect(contour)
 311        mask_scale = 1 / np.minimum(height, width)
 312
 313        small_mask = scale_contour(contour, 1 - mask_scale)
 314        large_mask = scale_contour(contour, 1 + mask_scale)
 315        scaled_mask = np.append(contour, small_mask, axis=0)
 316        scaled_mask = np.append(scaled_mask, large_mask, axis=0)
 317
 318        # mask = np.zeros_like(x)
 319        # cv2.drawContours(mask, [scaled_mask], 0, 255, 1)
 320        # reduced_mask = mask[xy_s]
 321        reduced_mask = get_contour_mask(scaled_mask if wider_contour else contour, x, xy_s)
 322        # plt.imshow(mask[xy_s], cmap='gray')
 323
 324        masks = np.array([reduced_mask, reduced_mask, reduced_mask])
 325
 326        # M = np.ma.masked_where(masks, M)
 327        dmdx = np.ma.masked_where(masks, dmdx)
 328        dmdx = np.ma.masked_where(masks, dmdx)
 329
 330        # M[0] = np.ma.masked_where(reduced_mask, M[0])
 331        # M[1] = np.ma.masked_where(reduced_mask, M[1])
 332        # M[2] = np.ma.masked_where(reduced_mask, M[2])
 333
 334        # dmdx = np.ma.masked_where(reduced_mask, dmdx)
 335        # dmdy = np.ma.masked_where(reduced_mask, dmdy)
 336
 337    cross_dmdx_dmdy = np.cross(dmdx, dmdy, axis=0)
 338    dot_m_dmdx_dmdy = np.einsum("i...,i...", M, cross_dmdx_dmdy)
 339
 340    return np.sum(dot_m_dmdx_dmdy) / (4 * np.pi)

 343def clean_image(image, sigma=50, h=25):
 344    """Remove gradient and noise from image."""
 345    # Rescale to 0..255 for filters
 346    image_shifted = np.asarray(rescale_to_8_bit(image))
 347
 348    image_denoised = cv2.fastNlMeansDenoising(
 349        np.asarray(rescale(image_shifted, 0, 255), dtype=np.uint8), None, h, 7, 21
 350    )
 351    image_denoised_blurred = gaussian_filter(image_denoised, sigma)
 352
 353    return rescale_to(image_denoised, image), rescale_to(image_denoised_blurred, image)

 356def ciecam02_cmap():
 357    """Create a perceptually uniform colormap based on CIECAM02."""
 358    # Based on https://stackoverflow.com/questions/23712207/cyclic-colormap-without-visual-distortions-for-use-in-phase-angle-plots
 359
 360    # first draw a circle in the cylindrical JCh color space.
 361    # First channel is lightness, second chroma, third hue in degrees.
 362    color_circle = np.ones((256, 3)) * 60
 363    color_circle[:, 1] = np.ones((256)) * 45
 364    color_circle[:, 2] = np.arange(0, 360, 360 / 256)
 365    color_circle_rgb = cspace_convert(color_circle, "JCh", "sRGB1")
 366
 367    return mpl.colors.ListedColormap(color_circle_rgb)
 368
 369
 370def ciecam02_cmap_r():
 371    """Create a perceptually uniform colormap based on CIECAM02."""
 372    # Based on https://stackoverflow.com/questions/23712207/cyclic-colormap-without-visual-distortions-for-use-in-phase-angle-plots
 373
 374    # first draw a circle in the cylindrical JCh color space.
 375    # First channel is lightness, second chroma, third hue in degrees.
 376    color_circle = np.ones((256, 3)) * 60
 377    color_circle[:, 1] = np.ones((256)) * 45
 378    color_circle[:, 2] = np.arange(360, 0, 360 / 256)
 379    color_circle_rgb = cspace_convert(color_circle, "JCh", "sRGB1")
 380
 381    return mpl.colors.ListedColormap(color_circle_rgb)

 384def file_for(files, token):
 385    """Convenience method for extracting file locations"""
 386
 387    return files[[i for i, item in enumerate(files) if token in item]][0]

 390def find_circular_contours(img, diff_threshold=0.3, comparator="gt", show=False, ltem=False):
 391    """Return an array of circular contours found in the input image. Also return the full array of contours."""
 392    circle_contours = []
 393
 394    # Work on the values above (default) or below the mean
 395    # threshold = img.mean()
 396    threshold = np.pi / 2 if not ltem else img.mean()
 397    ups = np.where(img > threshold, 255, 0) if comparator == "gt" else np.where(img < threshold, 255, 0)
 398    # ups = np.logical_and(0.9 * np.pi / 2 <= img, img <= 1.1 * np.pi / 2)
 399
 400    # OpenCV requires unsigned ints
 401    ups_b = ups.astype(np.uint8)
 402    kernel = circle_array(3)
 403    ups = cv2.morphologyEx(ups_b, cv2.MORPH_CLOSE, kernel)
 404    xdim, ydim = ups.shape[1], ups.shape[0]
 405
 406    if show:
 407        plt.figure(figsize=(12, 6))
 408        plt.subplot(121)
 409        plt.imshow(ups_b, cmap="gray")
 410        plt.subplot(122)
 411        plt.imshow(ups, cmap="gray")
 412
 413    # Find all contours
 414    contours, _ = cv2.findContours(ups, cv2.RETR_LIST, cv2.CHAIN_APPROX_NONE)
 415    # print(np.asarray(contours).shape)
 416
 417    # Remove the contours that are on the edges
 418    contours_g = [
 419        contour
 420        for contour in contours
 421        if 0 not in contour
 422        and xdim - 1 not in contour[:, :, 0]
 423        and ydim - 1 not in contour[:, :, 1]
 424        and len(np.squeeze(contour).shape) == 2
 425    ]
 426
 427    for contour in [c for c in contours_g if len(c) > 4]:
 428        # Fit the contour to an ellipse. This requires there be at least 5 points in the contour
 429        # (thus the if). Throw out anything where the major and minor axes are different by more
 430        # than the threshold. Also check the area, as other shapes would meet the above.
 431        width, height = cv2.fitEllipse(contour)[1]
 432        # avg_radius = (width + height) / 4
 433        # expected_length = 2 * avg_radius * np.pi
 434        # length = cv2.arcLength(contour, True)
 435        # area = cv2.contourArea(contour)
 436        # expected_area = np.pi * avg_radius * avg_radius
 437
 438        diff_dims = np.abs(width - height)
 439        # diff_lengths = np.abs(expected_length - length)
 440        # diff_areas = np.abs(expected_area - area)
 441
 442        if (
 443            diff_dims < np.max([width, height]) * diff_threshold
 444            and is_contour_circular(contour, diff_threshold)
 445            # and diff_areas < np.max([expected_area, area]) * diff_threshold
 446            # and diff_lengths < np.max([expected_length, length]) * diff_threshold
 447        ):
 448            circle_contours.append(contour)
 449
 450        # approx = cv2.approxPolyDP(contour, 0.01 * cv2.arcLength(contour, True), True)
 451
 452    return circle_contours[::-1], contours_g[::-1], contours[::-1]
 453
 454
 455def find_com(img_1, img_2, img_3=None):
 456    """Use centroids to find center of mass."""
 457    # Get the image dimensions
 458    dimx, dimy = img_1.shape[1], img_1.shape[0]
 459
 460    # Calculate the 2D histogram to use for finding the CoM
 461    hist, _, _ = np.histogram2d(img_1.ravel(), img_2.ravel(), bins=dimx)
 462
 463    # Get position in histogram. This will be coordinates.
 464    x_cm = np.average(range(1, dimx + 1), weights=[np.sum(hist[:, x]) for x in range(dimx)])
 465    y_cm = np.average(range(1, dimy + 1), weights=[np.sum(hist[y, :]) for y in range(dimy)])
 466
 467    # Convert to original range
 468    x_cm = x_cm / dimx * np.ptp(img_1) + img_1.min()
 469    y_cm = y_cm / dimy * np.ptp(img_2) + img_2.min()
 470
 471    return x_cm, y_cm
 472
 473
 474def find_group_contours(contours):
 475    """Find groupings of circular contours."""
 476
 477    boxes, centers = get_bounding_boxes(contours)
 478
 479    # Determine total number of contours
 480    count = len(centers)
 481
 482    # Create a matrix of distances between contours
 483    distances = np.asarray([[calculate_distance(centers[i], centers[j]) for j in range(count)] for i in range(count)])
 484
 485    groups = []
 486    loners = []
 487    indices = list(range(0, len(boxes)))
 488
 489    while len(indices) > 0:
 490        # Take the first index in the list
 491        index = indices[0]
 492        neighbors = find_neighbors_for([index], boxes, distances)
 493
 494        # Examine results and pare down the list of indices
 495        found = loners if len(neighbors) == 1 else groups
 496
 497        found.append(neighbors)
 498        indices = [i for i in indices if i not in list(itertools.chain.from_iterable(found))]
 499
 500    return groups, loners
 501
 502
 503def find_minimum_in_contour(cnt, img, count=100):
 504    """Find the coordinates of the first of count minima in img that are inside cnt
 505
 506    Args:
 507        cnt (List of points): The contour
 508        img (2d image array): The image
 509        count (int, optional): The number of minima to find. Defaults to 100.
 510
 511    Returns:
 512        tuple: First minimum found in the contour
 513    """
 514    # Just examine the subset of img that's in the region of the contour
 515    boxes, _ = get_bounding_boxes([cnt])
 516    xmin, ymin, xext, yext = boxes[0]
 517    img_subset = img[ymin : ymin + yext, xmin : xmin + xext]
 518
 519    # Find the sorted list of indices for minima, then check if they are in the contour
 520    # Need to shift the points since they're from a subset of img
 521    minima = np.array(np.unravel_index(np.argsort(img_subset.ravel())[:count], (img_subset.shape))).T
 522    in_check = [cv2.pointPolygonTest(cnt, (m[1] + xmin, m[0] + ymin), False) for m in minima]
 523
 524    # Any indices in the contour will put a 1 in in_check; get the first one, then shift it
 525    raw_point = minima[in_check.index(1)]
 526    point = (raw_point[1] + xmin, raw_point[0] + ymin)
 527
 528    return point
 529
 530
 531def find_neighbors_for(indices, boxes, distances, neighbors=[], threshold=2):
 532    """Find nearest neighbors in to incoming indices."""
 533
 534    # Add the indices to list of neighbors, eliminating duplicates
 535    neighbors = np.unique(np.concatenate((neighbors, indices))).astype(int)
 536
 537    for index in indices:
 538        box = np.asarray(boxes[index])
 539        dists = distances[index]
 540
 541        # Use threshold to determine what's considered close.
 542        d = np.max(box[2:]) * threshold
 543
 544        # Find all boxes between 0 exclusive (ignore box being 0 from itself) and d,
 545        # eliminating duplicates
 546        new_indices = np.atleast_1d(np.squeeze(np.where(np.logical_and(0 < dists, dists <= d))))
 547        new_indices = [i for i in new_indices if i not in neighbors]
 548
 549        # print(f'Looking at {index}, found {new_indices} with neighbors {neighbors}')
 550
 551        # Recursively call self to follow leads
 552        neighbors = np.unique(
 553            np.concatenate(
 554                (
 555                    neighbors,
 556                    find_neighbors_for(new_indices, boxes, distances, neighbors),
 557                )
 558            )
 559        )
 560
 561    return neighbors.tolist()
 562
 563
 564def find_offsets(img_1, img_2, img_3=None):
 565    """Minimize the min to max spread of the images to get most consistent magnitude."""
 566    # Find a reasonable starting point
 567    # x0 = find_com(img_1, img_2, img_3)
 568
 569    img3 = img_3 if img_3 is not None else np.zeros_like(img_1)
 570
 571    x0 = (img_1.mean(), img_2.mean(), img3.mean())
 572    # bounds=(-4, 4)
 573
 574    vals = (np.max(abs(img_1)), np.max(abs(img_2)), np.max(abs(img_3)))
 575
 576    bounds = (np.multiply(-2, vals), np.multiply(2, vals))
 577
 578    res = least_squares(ptp_magnitudes, x0, jac_magnitudes, bounds=bounds, args=(img_1, img_2, img3))
 579    # res = least_squares(std_magnitudes, x0, method='trf', args=(img_1, img_2, img_3))
 580
 581    return res.x, res.status, res.message
 582
 583
 584def jac_magnitudes(variables, x, y, z):
 585    X, Y, Z = x - variables[0], y - variables[1], z - variables[2]
 586    denominator = np.sqrt(X**2 + Y**2 + Z**2)
 587
 588    return np.ptp(X / denominator), np.ptp(Y / denominator), np.ptp(Z / denominator)
 589
 590
 591def fit_image(image, mask=None):
 592    """Return a least-squares fitting of the input image. Allow specifying a mask to fit a subsection of the image."""
 593    if mask is None:
 594        mask = np.ones_like(image)
 595
 596    # Get dimensions
 597    y_dim, x_dim = image.shape
 598
 599    # Flatten the mask to eliminate masked off indices
 600    mask_flat = np.array(mask.flatten(), dtype=bool)
 601
 602    # The linalg function needs flattened arrays of coordinates and values
 603    x, y = np.linspace(0, x_dim, x_dim), np.linspace(0, y_dim, y_dim)
 604    X, Y = np.meshgrid(x, y, copy=False)
 605    X, Y = X.flatten(), Y.flatten()
 606
 607    # Set up arrays for linalg function
 608    A = np.array(
 609        [
 610            X * 0 + 1,
 611            X,
 612            Y,
 613            X**2,
 614            X**2 * Y,
 615            X**2 * Y**2,
 616            Y**2,
 617            X * Y**2,
 618            X * Y,
 619        ]
 620    ).T
 621    B = image.flatten()
 622
 623    coeff, _, _, _ = np.linalg.lstsq(A[mask_flat], B[mask_flat], rcond=None)
 624
 625    image_fit = np.sum(coeff * A, axis=1).reshape(image.shape)
 626    image_fit_masked = image_fit * mask
 627
 628    return image_fit, image_fit_masked
 629
 630
 631def get_bounding_boxes(contours):
 632    """Return the bounding boxes for the passed in contours"""
 633    boxes = [cv2.boundingRect(contour) for contour in contours]
 634    centers = [(x + int(x_ext / 2), y + int(y_ext / 2)) for x, y, x_ext, y_ext in boxes]
 635
 636    return boxes, centers
 637
 638
 639def get_contour_mask(contour, img, xy_s=None):
 640    """Return an array corresponding to the contour
 641
 642    Args:
 643        contour (list of points): points in the contour
 644        img (array): image array
 645        xy_s (range): subsection of the image
 646    """
 647
 648    mask = np.zeros_like(img)
 649    cv2.drawContours(mask, [contour], 0, 255, 1)
 650
 651    return mask if xy_s is None else mask[xy_s]

 654def get_file_key(file_path, key):
 655    """Return a simple string representation of a key in the image file."""
 656
 657    # Valid values:
 658    # ['horizontal_min', 'horizontal_max', 'vertical_min', 'vertical_max', 'horizontal_full_scale',
 659    #  'vertical_full_scale', 'magnification', 'file_path', 'title', 'note', 'sample_id', 'start_time',
 660    # 'end_time', 'counter_gate_delay', 'counter_gate_width', 'adc_delay', 'period', 'detector',
 661    #  'channel_name', 'ix_counter_zero', 'mx_counter_zero', 'iy_counter_zero', 'my_counter_zero',
 662    #  'mx_sherman', 'my_sherman', 'accelerating_voltage', 'probe_current', 'num_overscan_columns',
 663    #  'scan_index', 'repeat_index', 'num_repeats', 'num_averages', 'horizontal_drift', 'vertical_drift',
 664    #  'run_uuid', 'image_data']
 665
 666    file = Dataset(file_path, "r")
 667
 668    data = file.variables[key][...].data
 669    if data.shape != ():
 670        data = b"".join(data).decode()
 671
 672    return data

 674
 675def get_magnitudes(im_x, im_y, im_z=None):
 676    """Return magnitudes of combined images: low -> dark, high -> light."""
 677    # Handle 2d case.
 678    im_z = np.zeros_like(im_x) if im_z is None else im_z
 679
 680    magnitudes = np.sqrt(im_x**2 + im_y**2 + im_z**2)
 681
 682    return magnitudes.reshape(im_x.shape)
 683
 684
 685def get_phases(im_x, im_y, im_z=None):
 686    """Return phases of combined images in radians."""
 687    # First determine phi from X and Y normalized
 688    phis = np.arctan2(im_y / im_y.max(), im_x / im_x.max())
 689
 690    # arctan2 works over the range -pi to pi; shift everything to 0 to 2pi
 691    # for color mapping
 692    phis = [[x if x >= 0 else x + 2 * np.pi for x in row] for row in phis]
 693
 694    # Now Z. Set to pi/2 for 2D.
 695    thetas = np.ones_like(im_x) * np.pi / 2
 696
 697    if im_z is not None:
 698        # Get the XY magnitudes, then arctan Z over that. Range 0 to pi.
 699        xy_magnitudes = get_magnitudes(im_x, im_y)
 700        thetas = -np.arctan2(im_z / im_z.max(), xy_magnitudes / xy_magnitudes.max()) + np.pi / 2
 701
 702    return (np.asarray(phis), thetas)
 703
 704
 705def get_phi_diff(path, phis, thetas, mod=2 * np.pi, flip_y=True):
 706    """Determine the average angle of magnetization relative to the
 707    contour it circles."""
 708    # Flip the sign of y for matplotlib (y=0 is at the top)
 709    factor = -1 if flip_y else 1
 710
 711    # Determine the angle along the path from point to point. Need to
 712    # roll to connect end to beginning.
 713    path_diff = np.roll(path, -2) - path
 714    path_angle = np.arctan2(factor * path_diff[:, 1], path_diff[:, 0])
 715    # print(f"Path angle: {path_angle}")
 716
 717    # Collect the phis along the path and subtract them from the path angles
 718    phis_path = np.array([phis[point[1], point[0]] for point in path])
 719    phis_diff = phis_path - path_angle
 720    # print(f'Phis path: {phis_path}')
 721    # print(f'Phis diff: {phis_diff}')
 722
 723    # Find the minimum theta inside the path for calculating alpha
 724    if thetas is not None:
 725        center = find_minimum_in_contour(path, thetas)
 726        center_diff = center - np.roll(path, -2)
 727        center_angle = np.arctan2(center_diff[:, 1], center_diff[:, 0])
 728           
 729        thetas_gradient = np.gradient(thetas)
 730        grad_angle = np.arctan2(*thetas_gradient)
 731        thetas_angle = np.array([grad_angle[point[1], point[0]] for point in path])
 732        # print(f'Thetas gradient path: {thetas_angle}')
 733 
 734    # Calculate alpha per JC's definition: deviation from domain wall normal traveling
 735    # from low M_z to high M_z. Alpha ranges from 0 to 2 pi. The path goes clockwise
 736    # around the contour. For now, assume the center of the contour is where high M_z
 737    # is, thus clockwise travel should be pi/2 while anticlockwise should be 3/2 pi.
 738    # Also: take a mod
 739    # alphas = (phis_path + center_angle) % mod
 740    # alphas = (phis_diff + np.pi / 2) % mod
 741    alphas = (phis_path + thetas_angle - np.pi) % mod if thetas is not None else (phis_diff + np.pi / 2) % mod
 742    
 743    # print(f'\N{greek small letter phi}: {np.min(phis_diff):.2f} to {np.max(phis_diff):.2f}; '\
 744    #       f'\N{greek small letter alpha}: {np.min(alphas):.2f} to {np.max(alphas):.2f}')
 745
 746    return (
 747        np.mean(phis_diff),
 748        np.std(phis_diff, ddof=1),
 749        np.mean(alphas),
 750        np.std(alphas, ddof=1),
 751        phis_diff,
 752        alphas,
 753    )
 754

 756def get_scale(file_path):
 757    """Determine the size of a single pixel in the input image."""
 758    file = Dataset(file_path, "r")
 759
 760    full_scale = np.abs(file.variables["vertical_full_scale"][...].data)
 761    magnification = np.abs(file.variables["magnification"][...].data)
 762    dim = file.variables["image_data"].shape[0]
 763
 764    adjusted_scale = full_scale / magnification / dim
 765
 766    return adjusted_scale, magnification
 767

 769def image_data(file_path):
 770    """Read a file in NetCDF format and return the image data and axis."""
 771    file = Dataset(file_path, "r")
 772
 773    return file.variables["image_data"][...].data.T, str(file.variables["channel_name"][...].data[1], "utf-8")

 776def import_files(name, runs, indir):
 777    # Read in image files. Return a dictionary of image data
 778    # {im1: [], im2: [], m1: [], m2: [], m3: [], m4: [], scale: scale}
 779
 780    image_dict = {}
 781
 782    print(f"Searching {name}* for runs {runs}...")
 783
 784    # Get all the i* and m* files. Should end up with 8 of them.
 785
 786    files = []
 787
 788    for run in runs:
 789        full_name = name + f"{run:0>3}"
 790        file = indir + full_name
 791
 792        for f in ["x", "y", "z"]:
 793            files.extend(glob.glob(file + "*" + f + "*" + sempa_file_suffix))
 794
 795    files = np.array(sorted(files), dtype="object")
 796    fnames = [f.split("/")[-1] for f in files]
 797    print(f"Found files:\n{fnames}")
 798
 799    # ix, ix2, iy, iz
 800    # ix and iy are the same; similarly, ix2 and iz are the same. Ignore 2.
 801    # The two images will be used to align the data
 802
 803    i_extensions = ["ix.", "ix2"]
 804
 805    for i in range(len(i_extensions)):
 806        key = "i{}".format(i + 1)
 807        im, _ = image_data(file_for(files, i_extensions[i]))
 808        im_blurred = median_filter(im, 3)
 809
 810        image_dict[key] = [im, im_blurred, im - im_blurred]
 811
 812    # mx, mx2, my, mz
 813    # Stick with 1, 2, 3 for x, y, z; 4 will be the second x for data scaling
 814    extensions = ["mx.", "my", "mz", "mx2"]
 815
 816    for i in range(len(extensions)):
 817        key = "m{}".format(i + 1)
 818        m, ax = image_data(file_for(files, extensions[i]))
 819
 820        image_dict[key] = [m, ax]
 821        image_dict[key].extend(m.shape)
 822        image_dict[key].extend([m.min(), m.max()])
 823
 824    scale, magnification = get_scale(files[0])
 825    image_dict["scale"] = scale
 826    image_dict["magnification"] = magnification
 827
 828    return image_dict
 829
 830
 831def is_contour_circular(contour, threshold=0.2):
 832    """Determine if the area of the contour is circular
 833
 834    Args:
 835        contour (contour): The contour to examine
 836        threshold (float): Acceptable eccentricity; 0 = exact circle
 837
 838    Returns:
 839        boolean: Is it a circle (within threshold)?
 840    """
 841    width, height = cv2.fitEllipse(contour)[1]
 842    avg_radius = (width + height) / 4
 843    area = cv2.contourArea(contour)
 844    expected_area = np.pi * avg_radius * avg_radius
 845
 846    diff_areas = np.abs(expected_area - area)
 847
 848    return diff_areas < area * threshold
 849
 850
 851def limit_to(image, sigma=3):
 852    """Restrict the image range to + or - sigma std deviations"""
 853
 854    std = np.std(image)
 855    image_mean = np.mean(image)
 856    image_min, image_max = image_mean - sigma * std, image_mean + sigma + std
 857
 858    image = np.where(image < image_min, image_min, image)
 859    image = np.where(image > image_max, image_max, image)
 860
 861    return image
 862
 863
 864def mean_shift_filter(image, sp=1, sr=1):
 865    """Perform mean shift filtering."""
 866    # Convert to 8 bit color for the filter
 867    img = np.asarray(rescale_to_8_bit(image))
 868    img = cv2.cvtColor(median_filter(img, 5), cv2.COLOR_GRAY2BGR)
 869
 870    # sp = spatial window, sr = color window
 871    img_shift = cv2.pyrMeanShiftFiltering(img, sp, sr)
 872
 873    # Convert back to grayscale
 874    img_shift = cv2.cvtColor(img_shift, cv2.COLOR_BGR2GRAY)
 875
 876    return rescale_to(img_shift, image)
 877
 878
 879def normalize_3d(x, y, z):
 880    """Perform element-wise normalization of 3 arrays"""
 881
 882    # First square the arrays, then perform element-wise sum
 883    x2, y2, z2 = x**2, y**2, z**2
 884    sum_xyz2 = np.sum((x2, y2, z2), axis=0)
 885
 886    # Return the square root of each array divided by the sum array
 887    return (
 888        np.sqrt(np.abs(x2 / sum_xyz2)) * np.sign(x),
 889        np.sqrt(np.abs(y2 / sum_xyz2)) * np.sign(y),
 890        np.sqrt(np.abs(z2 / sum_xyz2)) * np.sign(z) * -1,
 891    )
 892
 893
 894def process_ltem_data(ltem_data_path):
 895    """Return data for .npy or .npz formatted LTEM data"""
 896
 897    zfile = ltem_data_path[-1] == "z"
 898    # Data format is array of complex numbers, real = x, imaginary = y
 899    ltem_data = np.load(ltem_data_path)
 900    ltem_data_xy = ltem_data if not zfile else (ltem_data["Bx"] + 1j * ltem_data["By"])
 901
 902    # Determine pixel size
 903    xerror = 0 if not zfile else (ltem_data["x"][1] - ltem_data["x"][0])  # * scale_multiplier
 904    yerror = 0 if not zfile else (ltem_data["y"][1] - ltem_data["y"][0])  # * scale_multiplier
 905
 906    # Get phases and magnitudes
 907    ltem_phases, _ = get_phases(np.real(ltem_data_xy), np.imag(ltem_data_xy))
 908
 909    ltem_magnitudes = get_magnitudes(np.real(ltem_data_xy), np.imag(ltem_data_xy))
 910
 911    # ltem_circular_contours, ltem_contours_g, _ = find_circular_contours(
 912    #     ltem_magnitudes > np.average(ltem_magnitudes))
 913
 914    # Find contours; throw out any that too short or too long; scale them up to move into
 915    # the domain wall; get rid of contours that go off the edge of the image
 916    ltem_height, ltem_width = ltem_magnitudes.shape
 917    size = ltem_width
 918
 919    ltem_circular_contours, ltem_contours_g, _ = find_circular_contours(ltem_magnitudes, ltem=True)
 920    ltem_circular_contours = [c for c in ltem_circular_contours if len(c) > 0.05 * size and len(c) < 0.4 * size]
 921    ltem_circular_contours = [scale_contour(c, 1.3) for c in ltem_circular_contours]
 922    ltem_circular_contours = [c for c in ltem_circular_contours if np.min(c) >= 0 and np.max(c) < size]
 923
 924    # ltem_alphas = np.asarray([get_phi_diff(np.squeeze(c), ltem_phases)
 925    #                           for c in ltem_circular_contours])
 926
 927    return (
 928        ltem_phases,
 929        ltem_magnitudes,
 930        ltem_circular_contours,
 931        ltem_contours_g,
 932        xerror,
 933        yerror,
 934    )
 935
 936
 937def ptp_magnitudes(variables, image_1, image_2, image_3=None):
 938    """Calculate the min to max spreads for magnitudes; used for optimizing the offset."""
 939
 940    # Allow for 2D processing
 941    var_3 = variables[2] if image_3 is not None else 0
 942    arg_3 = image_3 - variables[2] if image_3 is not None else np.zeros_like(image_1)
 943
 944    return np.ptp(get_magnitudes(image_1 - variables[0], image_2 - variables[1], arg_3 - var_3))
 945
 946
 947def std_magnitudes(variables, image_1, image_2, image_3=None):
 948    """Calculate the min to max spreads for magnitudes; used for optimizing the offset."""
 949
 950    # Allow for 2D processing
 951    var_3 = variables[2] if image_3 is not None else 0
 952    arg_3 = image_3 - variables[2] if image_3 is not None else np.zeros_like(image_1)
 953
 954    return np.std(get_magnitudes(image_1 - variables[0], image_2 - variables[1], arg_3 - var_3))
 955
 956
 957def remove_line_errors(image, lines, use_rows=True):
 958    """Remove line errors using either rows or columns."""
 959    image_base = image if use_rows else image.T
 960
 961    image_mean = np.asarray([np.mean(image_base[:lines, x]) for x in range(image.shape[1])]).T
 962
 963    image_delined = image_base - np.tile(image_mean, (image.shape[0], 1))
 964
 965    image_delined = image_delined if use_rows else image_delined.T
 966
 967    return image_delined
 968
 969
 970def render_phases_and_magnitudes(phases, magnitudes):
 971    """Adjust the intensity of the contrast image according to phase magnitude."""
 972    # Set up the colormap
 973    cmap = ciecam02_cmap()
 974
 975    # Use CIECAM02 color map, convert to sRGB1 (to facilitate intensity adjustment)
 976    im = cmap(phases / (2 * np.pi))
 977    im_srgb = im[:, :, :3]
 978    im_adjusted = np.zeros_like(im_srgb)
 979
 980    # Apply phase intensity mask to the contrast: low intensity -> dark, high intensity -> light
 981    for i in range(3):
 982        im_adjusted[:, :, i] = np.multiply(
 983            # im_srgb[:, :, i], rescale_to(magnitudes, [0.3, 1]))
 984            im_srgb[:, :, i],
 985            rescale_to(magnitudes, [0, 1]),
 986        )
 987
 988    return im_adjusted
 989
 990
 991def rescale(data, to_min, to_max):
 992    """Rescale data to have to_min and to_max as min and max, respectively."""
 993    norm_data = (data - np.min(data)) / (np.max(data) - np.min(data))
 994    factor = to_max - to_min
 995
 996    return norm_data * factor + to_min
 997
 998
 999def rescale_to(source, target):
1000    """Rescale source image to the same range as target."""
1001    return rescale(source, np.min(target), np.max(target))
1002
1003
1004def rescale_to_8_bit(data):
1005    """Rescale data to 8 bit integers"""
1006    return np.asarray(rescale(data, 0, 255), dtype=np.uint8)

1010    file_path,

1023    """Save images to PNG files."""
1024

1030    ax.axes.get_yaxis().set_visible(False)

1034

1036    plt.figure(figsize=figsize, dpi=dpi)

1043

1045    plt.savefig(file_path + "_" + axis_1 + axis_2 + "_scale.png")
1046
1047    if img_denoised_1 is not None:
1048        show_vector_plot(img_denoised_1, img_denoised_2, ax=ax, color=arrow_color, scale=arrow_scale)
1049        plt.savefig(file_path + "_" + axis_1 + axis_2 + "_scale_arrows.png")

1069def scale_contour(cnt, scale, center_of=None):
1070    """Scale a contour.
1071
1072    Args:
1073        cnt (list of points): Contour to be scaled
1074        scale (float): Scale factor
1075        center_of (image): Optional image with origin point
1076
1077    Returns:
1078        list of points: The scaled contour
1079    """
1080    if center_of is None:
1081        # Find the centroid
1082        M = cv2.moments(cnt)
1083        cx = int(M["m10"] / M["m00"])
1084        cy = int(M["m01"] / M["m00"])
1085    else:
1086        cx, cy = find_minimum_in_contour(cnt, center_of)
1087
1088    # Translate the points, scale, translate back
1089    cnt_norm = cnt - [cx, cy]
1090    cnt_scaled = cnt_norm * scale
1091    cnt_scaled = cnt_scaled + [cx, cy]
1092    cnt_scaled = cnt_scaled.astype(np.int32)
1093
1094    # Remove dupes
1095    # print(cnt_scaled)
1096    if scale < 1:
1097        cnt1 = [cnt_scaled[0]]
1098        # print(f'Start: {cnt1} from {cnt_scaled[0]} from shape {cnt_scaled.shape}')
1099        for i in range(1, len(cnt_scaled)):
1100            # print(f'{i}: {cnt_scaled[i]}')
1101            current = cnt_scaled[i]
1102            last = cnt1[-1]
1103            if not (current[0][0] == last[0][0] and current[0][1] == last[0][1]):
1104                cnt1.append(current)
1105                # print(cnt1)
1106    else:
1107        cnt1 = cnt_scaled
1108
1109    return cnt1
1110
1111
1112def segment_image(image, segments=1, adaptive=False, sel=circle_array(1), erode_iter=1, close_iter=7):
1113    """Segment image into a defined number of objects. Create positive and negative masks for those objects."""
1114    # Rescale to 0-255 for thresholding
1115    image_shift = np.asarray(rescale_to_8_bit(image))
1116    _, image_thresh = cv2.threshold(image_shift, image_shift.mean(), 255, cv2.THRESH_BINARY_INV + cv2.THRESH_OTSU)
1117
1118    # Alternative thresholding mechanism
1119    # m_1_thresh = cv2.adaptiveThreshold(m_1_shift, 255, cv2.ADAPTIVE_THRESH_GAUSSIAN_C, cv2.THRESH_BINARY_INV, 35, 0)
1120    # m_1_shift = cv2.cvtColor(m_1_shift, cv2.COLOR_GRAY2BGR)
1121
1122    # Perform morphological operations. First kill small noise, then close the image
1123    image_thresh = cv2.morphologyEx(image_thresh, cv2.MORPH_ERODE, sel, iterations=erode_iter)
1124    image_thresh = cv2.morphologyEx(image_thresh, cv2.MORPH_CLOSE, sel, iterations=close_iter)
1125
1126    # Find the segment contours
1127    snakes = cv2.findContours(image_thresh, cv2.RETR_EXTERNAL, cv2.CHAIN_APPROX_NONE)
1128
1129    # Sort the results by size and keep the requested number
1130    snakes = imutils.grab_contours(snakes)
1131    snakes = sorted(snakes, key=cv2.contourArea, reverse=True)[:segments]
1132
1133    # Handle possibly having fewer than specified number of segments
1134    found = min(segments, len(snakes))
1135
1136    # Allocate for segment # of binary masks, positive and negative, each the size of the image
1137    masks = np.empty((found, 2, image.shape[1], image.shape[0]))
1138
1139    for i in range(found):
1140        contour = snakes[i]
1141        mask = cv2.fillPoly(np.zeros_like(image), [contour], 1)
1142        masks[i, 0] = mask
1143        masks[i, 1] = np.ones_like(mask) - mask
1144        cv2.drawContours(image_shift, [contour], -1, (0, 255, 0), 1)
1145
1146    # Draw the contours on the shifted input image
1147    #     for (i, c) in enumerate(snakes):
1148    #         ((x, y), _) = cv2.minEnclosingCircle(c)
1149    #         cv2.drawContours(image_shift, [c], -1, (0, 255, 0), 1)
1150
1151    return image_thresh, image_shift, masks
1152
1153
1154def show_all_circles(
1155    img,
1156    contours,
1157    phis=None,
1158    thetas=None,
1159    ax=None,
1160    show_numbers=True,
1161    reverse=False,
1162    alpha=1,
1163    color="black",
1164    show_axes=True,
1165    origin="upper",
1166):
1167    """Plot all circular contours."""
1168
1169    if reverse:
1170        contours = contours[::-1]
1171
1172    # Convert img to color and draw the contours
1173    c_img = cv2.cvtColor(np.zeros_like(img, dtype=np.uint8), cv2.COLOR_GRAY2RGB)
1174    cv2.drawContours(c_img, contours, -1, (255, 255, 255), 1)
1175
1176    # Convert resultant image back to grayscale to produce a mask
1177    c_img_gray = cv2.cvtColor(c_img, cv2.COLOR_RGB2GRAY)
1178    masked_circles = np.ma.masked_where(c_img_gray == 0, c_img_gray)
1179    # plt.imshow(~masked_circles.mask)
1180    # print(~masked_circles.mask)
1181
1182    # Use the mask to produce an RBGA image (transparent background)
1183    c_img_rgba = cv2.cvtColor(c_img, cv2.COLOR_RGB2RGBA)
1184    c_img_rgba[:, :, 3] = masked_circles
1185
1186    boxes, centers = get_bounding_boxes(contours)
1187
1188    if ax is not None:
1189        cmap_to_show = cm.binary_r if color == "black" else cm.binary
1190
1191        if phis is None:
1192            ax.imshow(
1193                masked_circles,
1194                interpolation="none",
1195                alpha=alpha,
1196                cmap=cmap_to_show,
1197                zorder=100,
1198                origin=origin,
1199            )
1200        else:
1201            for index in range(len(boxes)):
1202                contour = contours[index]
1203                path = np.squeeze(contour)
1204                _, _, alpha_avg, _, _, _ = get_phi_diff(path, phis, thetas, origin == "upper")
1205                chirality = np.pi / 2 if alpha_avg < np.pi else 3 * np.pi / 2
1206                m = get_contour_mask(contour, phis)
1207                mask = np.ma.masked_where(m == 0, m) / 255 * chirality
1208
1209                ax.imshow(
1210                    mask, interpolation="none", alpha=alpha, origin=origin, vmin=0, vmax=2 * np.pi, cmap="plasma_r"
1211                )
1212
1213        if show_numbers:
1214            for index in range(len(boxes)):
1215                ax.text(
1216                    centers[index][0],
1217                    centers[index][1],
1218                    index + 1,
1219                    alpha=alpha,
1220                    color=color,
1221                    horizontalalignment="center",
1222                    verticalalignment="center",
1223                )
1224
1225        if not show_axes:
1226            ax.set_xticks([])
1227            ax.set_yticks([])
1228
1229    return masked_circles, c_img_rgba, boxes
1230

1232def show_alphas(
1233    contours_g,
1234    circular_contours,
1235    phis,
1236    thetas,
1237    name,
1238    show_circles_separately=True,
1239    bins=20,
1240    ltem_data=None,
1241    show_title=True,
1242):
1243    all_alphas = np.asarray([get_phi_diff(np.squeeze(c), phis, thetas) for c in contours_g])
1244
1245    circle_alphas = np.asarray([get_phi_diff(np.squeeze(c), phis, thetas) for c in circular_contours])
1246
1247    # Define color maps
1248    colors = {"all": "blue", "circles": "orange", "ltem": "green"}
1249    all_hist_type = "step" if show_circles_separately else "stepfilled"
1250
1251    # Create a simulated phi distribution for LTEM if not provided
1252    p = [0.0, 0.1, 0.75, 0.1, 0.0, 0.01, 0.03, 0.01, 0]
1253    ltem_data = (
1254        np.random.choice(np.arange(0, 2.25 * np.pi, np.pi / 4), len(all_alphas), p=p)
1255        if ltem_data is None
1256        else ltem_data
1257    )
1258
1259    plt.figure(figsize=(10, 5))
1260    hist_all = plt.hist(
1261        all_alphas[:, 2],
1262        bins=bins,
1263        color=colors["all"],
1264        alpha=0.5,
1265        histtype=all_hist_type,
1266        density=True,
1267        label="SEMPA",
1268    )
1269    if show_circles_separately:
1270        hist_circle = plt.hist(
1271            circle_alphas[:, 2],
1272            bins=bins,
1273            color=colors["circles"],
1274            alpha=0.5,
1275            density=True,
1276            label="SEMPA (circular)",
1277        )
1278    hist_ltem = plt.hist(
1279        ltem_data,
1280        bins=bins,
1281        color=colors["ltem"],
1282        alpha=0.5,
1283        density=True,
1284        label="LTEM",
1285    )
1286
1287    # Find the indices of the maxima for all and LTEM
1288    lbin_all = np.argmax(hist_all[0])
1289    lbin_ltem = np.argmax(hist_ltem[0])
1290
1291    # Circular is a bit more complicated since it seems to have 2 big humps.
1292    # First, round all values to 4 places, select unique values, and sort
1293    # descending, keeping the first 2 value (top 2). Then find the indices
1294    # for those values.
1295    if show_circles_separately:
1296        tops_circle = sorted(np.unique(np.around(hist_circle[0], 4)), reverse=True)[:2]
1297        lbin_circle = [np.where(np.around(hist_circle[0], 4) == t) for t in tops_circle]
1298    else:
1299        tops_circle = sorted(np.unique(np.around(hist_all[0], 0)), reverse=True)[:2]
1300        lbin_circle = [np.where(np.around(hist_all[0], 0) == t) for t in tops_circle]
1301
1302    # Now find the modes
1303    mode_all = (hist_all[1][lbin_all + 1] + hist_all[1][lbin_all]) / 2
1304    mode_ltem = (hist_ltem[1][lbin_ltem + 1] + hist_ltem[1][lbin_ltem]) / 2
1305
1306    plt.axvline(mode_all, linestyle="dashed", linewidth=1, color=colors["all"])
1307    plt.axvline(mode_ltem, linestyle="dashed", linewidth=1, color=colors["ltem"])
1308
1309    use_hist = hist_all if not show_circles_separately else hist_circle
1310    if show_circles_separately:
1311        mode_circle = (hist_circle[1][lbin_circle[0][0][-1] + 1] + hist_circle[1][lbin_circle[0][0][0]]) / 2
1312        mode_circle_2 = (hist_circle[1][lbin_circle[1][0][-1] + 1] + hist_circle[1][lbin_circle[1][0][-1]]) / 2
1313        # mode_circle = (use_hist[1][lbin_circle[0][0][-1] + 1] +
1314        #                use_hist[1][lbin_circle[0][0][0]]) / 2
1315        # mode_circle_2 = (use_hist[1][lbin_circle[1][0][-1] + 1] +
1316        #                  use_hist[1][lbin_circle[1][0][-1]]) / 2
1317
1318        plt.axvline(mode_circle, linestyle="dashed", linewidth=1, color=colors["circles"])
1319        plt.axvline(mode_circle_2, linestyle="dashed", linewidth=1, color=colors["circles"])
1320
1321    # Place text labels for the modes
1322    _, y_lim = plt.ylim()
1323    shift_x = 1.05
1324    t = plt.text(mode_all * shift_x, y_lim * 0.7, f"{mode_all:.2f}")
1325    t.set_bbox(dict(facecolor="white", alpha=0.8, edgecolor=colors["all"]))
1326
1327    if show_circles_separately:
1328        t = plt.text(mode_circle * shift_x, y_lim * 0.9, f"{mode_circle:.2f}")
1329        t.set_bbox(dict(facecolor="white", alpha=0.8, edgecolor=colors["circles"]))
1330        t = plt.text(mode_circle_2 * shift_x, y_lim * 0.85, f"{mode_circle_2:.2f}")
1331        t.set_bbox(dict(facecolor="white", alpha=0.8, edgecolor=colors["circles"]))
1332
1333    t = plt.text(mode_ltem * shift_x, y_lim * 0.7, f"{mode_ltem:.2f}")
1334    t.set_bbox(dict(facecolor="white", alpha=0.8, edgecolor=colors["ltem"]))
1335
1336    plt.xlim(0, 2 * np.pi)
1337
1338    tick_labels = [
1339        "0",
1340        r"$\dfrac{\pi}{4}$",
1341        r"$\dfrac{\pi}{2}$",
1342        r"$\dfrac{3\pi}{4}$",
1343        r"$\pi$",
1344        r"$\dfrac{5\pi}{4}$",
1345        r"$\dfrac{3\pi}{2}$",
1346        r"$\dfrac{7\pi}{4}$",
1347        r"$2\pi$",
1348    ]
1349    plt.xticks(np.arange(0, 2.25 * np.pi, step=np.pi / 4), tick_labels)
1350    plt.yticks([])
1351
1352    plt.xlabel(r"$\alpha$ [Radians]")
1353    if show_title:
1354        plt.title(rf"Average $\alpha$ for {name}")
1355
1356    plt.legend()
1357
1358    return plt, all_alphas, circle_alphas
1359

1361def show_alphas_2(
1362    alphas_candidates,
1363    alphas_all,
1364    alphas_ltem,
1365    name=r"$\alpha$",
1366    show_all=True,
1367    show_title=True,

1369    plt.figure(figsize=((10, 5)))
1370

1372    if show_all:

1391            np.array(
1392                find_peaks(
1393                    np.concatenate(([0], a_hist_arr, [0])),
1394                    distance=len(a_hist_arr) // 2,
1395                )[0]
1396            )
1397            - 1
1398        )
1399        a_max_bin_centers = [a_hist_bins[x] + a_bin_width / 2 for x in a_peak_indices]
1400
1401    l_bin_width = l_hist_bins[1] - l_hist_bins[0]
1402    l_peak_indices = np.array(find_peaks(np.concatenate(([0], l_hist_arr, [0])), distance=len(l_hist_arr) // 2)[0]) - 1

1416        t = plt.text(
1417            c + shift_x_pos,
1418            y_lim * c_y_adjust,
1419            rf"{c:.2f}{new_line}$\pm${c_bin_width / 2:.2f}",
1420            zorder=zbox,
1421        )
1422        t.set_bbox(
1423            dict(
1424                facecolor="white",
1425                alpha=box_alpha,
1426                zorder=20,
1427                edgecolor=colors["circles"],
1428            )
1429        )
1430
1431    if show_all:
1432        for a in a_max_bin_centers:
1433            plt.axvline(a, color=colors["all"], linestyle="dotted", zorder=zline)
1434            t = plt.text(
1435                a - shift_x_neg,
1436                y_lim * a_y_adjust,
1437                f"{a:.2f}{new_line}$\pm${a_bin_width / 2:.2f}",
1438                zorder=zbox,
1439            )
1440            t.set_bbox(
1441                dict(
1442                    facecolor="white",
1443                    alpha=box_alpha,
1444                    zorder=20,
1445                    edgecolor=colors["all"],
1446                )
1447            )
1448
1449    for l in l_max_bin_centers:
1450        plt.axvline(
1451            l,
1452            color=colors["ltem"] if show_all else colors["all"],
1453            linestyle="dotted",
1454            zorder=zline,
1455        )
1456        t = plt.text(
1457            l - shift_x_neg,
1458            y_lim * (l_y_adjust if show_all else a_y_adjust),
1459            f"{l:.2f}{new_line}$\pm${l_bin_width / 2:.2f}",
1460            zorder=zbox,
1461        )
1462        t.set_bbox(
1463            dict(
1464                facecolor="white",
1465                alpha=box_alpha,
1466                zorder=20,
1467                edgecolor=colors["ltem"] if show_all else colors["all"],
1468            )
1469        )
1470
1471    plt.xlabel(r"$\alpha$ [Radians]")
1472    plt.xlim((0, 2 * np.pi))
1473    tick_labels = [
1474        "0",
1475        r"$\dfrac{\pi}{4}$",
1476        r"$\dfrac{\pi}{2}$",
1477        r"$\dfrac{3\pi}{4}$",
1478        r"$\pi$",
1479        r"$\dfrac{5\pi}{4}$",
1480        r"$\dfrac{3\pi}{2}$",
1481        r"$\dfrac{7\pi}{4}$",
1482        r"$2\pi$",
1483    ]
1484    plt.xticks(np.arange(0, 2.25 * np.pi, step=np.pi / 4), tick_labels)
1485    plt.yticks([])
1486    plt.legend()
1487
1488    if show_title:
1489        plt.title = name

1492def show_alphas_3(features):
1493    ncols = 3
1494    nrows = int(np.ceil(len(features) / ncols))
1495
1496    fig = plt.figure(figsize=(ncols * 6, nrows * 6));
1497    spec = gs.GridSpec(ncols=ncols, nrows=nrows, figure=fig)
1498    row, col = 0, 0
1499
1500    for i in features.keys():
1501        c = features[i]
1502        alphas = c['alphas']
1503        alphas_1_3 = c['alphas_1_3']
1504        alphas_2_3 = c['alphas_2_3']
1505        alpha_avg = c['alpha_avg']
1506        alpha_avg_1_3 = c['alpha_avg_1_3']
1507        alpha_avg_2_3 = c['alpha_avg_2_3']
1508
1509        length = len(alphas)
1510        xs = np.arange(length)
1511        xs_1 = np.linspace(0, length, len(alphas_1_3))
1512        xs_2 = np.linspace(0, length, len(alphas_2_3))
1513
1514        ax = fig.add_subplot(spec[row, col])
1515        ax.scatter(xs, alphas, label='Wall');
1516        ax.scatter(xs_1, alphas_1_3, label='1/3');
1517        ax.scatter(xs_2, alphas_2_3, label='2/3');
1518        ax.axhline(np.pi, color="gray", ls="-", alpha=0.1)
1519        ax.axhline(
1520            alpha_avg,
1521            color="blue",
1522            ls="--",
1523            label=r"Avg $\alpha$",
1524            alpha=0.5
1525        )
1526        # ax.axhline(alpha_avg + mae, color="green", ls="-.", alpha=0.2)
1527        # ax.axhline(alpha_avg - mae, color="green", ls="-.", alpha=0.2)
1528        ax.axhline(np.pi, color="gray", ls="-", alpha=0.1)
1529        ax.axhline(
1530            alpha_avg_1_3,
1531            ls="--",
1532            color="orange",
1533            label=r"Avg $\alpha$ at $\frac{1}{3}$",
1534        )
1535        ax.axhline(
1536            alpha_avg_2_3,
1537            ls="--",
1538            color="green",
1539            label=r"Avg $\alpha$ at $\frac{2}{3}$",
1540        )
1541
1542        ax.set_ylim((0, 2 * np.pi))
1543        ax.set_xticks([])
1544        ax.set_yticks([0, np.pi / 2, np.pi, 3 / 2 * np.pi, 2 * np.pi])
1545        ax.set_yticklabels(
1546            [
1547                "0",
1548                r"$\dfrac{\pi}{2}$",
1549                r"$\pi$",
1550                r"$\dfrac{3\pi}{2}$",
1551                r"$2\pi$",
1552            ]
1553        )
1554        ax.set_title(f'{i}: {alpha_avg_1_3:.2f}, {alpha_avg_2_3:.2f}, {alpha_avg:.2f}')
1555        ax.legend(ncol=2);
1556
1557        col += 1
1558        if col == ncols:
1559            row += 1
1560            col = 0
1561

1563def show_antiskyrmions(contours, antiskyrmions, magnitudes, phis, thetas, scale, m_1_adjusted, m_2_adjusted, m_3_adjusted):
1564    contours_to_use = [contours[i] for i in antiskyrmions.keys()]
1565    
1566    show_circles(
1567        magnitudes,
1568        phis,
1569        thetas,
1570        contours_to_use,
1571        scale,
1572        m_1_adjusted,
1573        m_2_adjusted,
1574        m_3_adjusted,
1575        normalize=False,
1576        show="thetas",
1577        show_numbers=True,
1578        show_axes=True,
1579        show_title=True,
1580        just_candidates=False,
1581        show_anyway=True,
1582        show_limit=100,
1583    )
1584
1585    tick_labels = [
1586        "0",
1587        r"$\dfrac{\pi}{4}$",
1588        r"$\dfrac{\pi}{2}$",
1589        r"$\dfrac{3\pi}{4}$",
1590        r"$\pi$",
1591        r"$\dfrac{5\pi}{4}$",
1592        r"$\dfrac{3\pi}{2}$",
1593        r"$\dfrac{7\pi}{4}$",
1594        r"$2\pi$",
1595    ]
1596    ncols = 4
1597    nrows = int(np.ceil(len(antiskyrmions) / ncols))
1598    psize = 6
1599    row, col = 0, 0
1600
1601    fig = plt.figure(figsize=(ncols * psize, nrows * psize))
1602    spec = gs.GridSpec(ncols=ncols, nrows=nrows, figure=fig)
1603
1604    for i in antiskyrmions.keys():
1605        ants = antiskyrmions[i]
1606
1607        ax = fig.add_subplot(spec[row, col])
1608        ax.autoscale()
1609        values, bins, bars = ax.hist(ants['alphas'], bins=16, alpha=0.5, color='black', edgecolor='white')
1610
1611        ax.axvline(np.pi / 2, c='gray', alpha=0.5, zorder=10)
1612        ax.axvline(3/2 * np.pi, c='gray', alpha=0.5, zorder=10)
1613        
1614        fill_alpha = 0.2
1615        ax.fill_between(np.linspace(0, np.pi / 2, endpoint=True), max(values), color='red', zorder=0, alpha=fill_alpha)
1616        ax.fill_between(np.linspace(np.pi / 2, 3/2 * np.pi, endpoint=True), max(values), color='blue', zorder=0, alpha=fill_alpha)
1617        ax.fill_between(np.linspace(3/2 * np.pi, 2 * np.pi, endpoint=True), max(values), color='red', zorder=0, alpha=fill_alpha)
1618        
1619        # for j in range(len(values)):
1620        #     b = bins[j]
1621        #     c = 'blue' if np.pi / 2 < b < 3/2 * np.pi else 'red'
1622        #     bars[j].set_facecolor(c)
1623        
1624        c = 'black'
1625        t = ax.text(0, max(values), 'In', fontdict={"fontsize": 20}, c='red', horizontalalignment="left", verticalalignment="top")
1626        t.set_bbox(dict(facecolor="white", alpha=0.8, edgecolor=c))
1627        t = ax.text(np.pi, max(values), 'Out', fontdict={"fontsize": 20}, c='blue', horizontalalignment="center", verticalalignment="top", zorder=20)
1628        t.set_bbox(dict(facecolor="white", alpha=0.8, edgecolor=c))
1629        t = ax.text(1.9 * np.pi, max(values), 'In', fontdict={"fontsize": 20}, c='red', horizontalalignment="right", verticalalignment="top")
1630        t.set_bbox(dict(facecolor="white", alpha=0.8, edgecolor=c))
1631
1632        ax.set_xticks(np.arange(0, 2.25 * np.pi, step=np.pi / 4), tick_labels)
1633        ax.set_title(f'{i}: n = {ants["winding_number"]:.2f}')
1634        
1635        col += 2
1636        if col == ncols:
1637            row += 1
1638            col = 0

1641def show_circles(
1642    magnitudes,
1643    phis,
1644    thetas,
1645    contours,
1646    scale,
1647    m_1=None,
1648    m_2=None,
1649    m_3=None,
1650    show_numbers=True,
1651    reverse=False,
1652    alpha=0.5,
1653    show="thetas",
1654    normalize=True,
1655    show_both=False,
1656    phis_m=None,
1657    candidate_cutoff=np.pi / 6,
1658    show_title=True,
1659    show_axes=True,
1660    just_candidates=True,
1661    origin="upper",
1662    show_limit=30,
1663    show_anyway=False,
1664    show_plot=True,
1665    show_alphas=True,
1666    alpha_limit=2 * np.pi,
1667):
1668    """Plot all circular contours."""
1669    _, _, boxes = show_all_circles(thetas, contours, reverse=reverse, origin=origin)
1670    count = len(boxes)
1671    print(f"Found {count} features.")
1672
1673    yd, xd = magnitudes.shape
1674
1675    extent_factor = 0.3
1676
1677    # Track candidates. Cutoff of pi/6 allows for 3 sigma.
1678    candidates = {}
1679    all_contours = {}
1680    c_index, displayed = 0, 0
1681    cw, ccw = 0, 0
1682    # new_line = "\n"
1683    contours_to_plot = []
1684
1685    while c_index < len(boxes) and displayed < show_limit:
1686        box = boxes[c_index]
1687
1688        xmin, ymin, width, height = box
1689        width_nm = int(width * scale * scale_multiplier)
1690        height_nm = int(height * scale * scale_multiplier)
1691
1692        # Select the area to evaluate
1693        extent_x, extent_y = int(extent_factor * width), int(extent_factor * height)
1694        extent = np.min([extent_x, extent_y])
1695        xmin, ymin = np.max([xmin - extent, 0]), np.max([ymin - extent, 0])
1696        xmax = np.min([xmin + width + 2 * extent, xd])
1697        ymax = np.min([ymin + height + 2 * extent, yd])
1698        box_xd, box_yd = xmax - xmin, ymax - ymin
1699        y_s, x_s = slice(ymin, ymax), slice(xmin, xmax)
1700        xy_s = (y_s, x_s)
1701
1702        # Walk along the path of the contour and measure deviations from it
1703        path = contours[c_index]
1704
1705        # Determine winding number
1706        if m_1 is not None:
1707            winding_number = calculate_winding_number(m_1, m_2, m_3, xy_s, path, wider_contour=False)
1708        else:
1709            winding_number = None
1710
1711        # Scale the path to 1/3 and 2/3 for further alpha evaluation
1712        path_1_3 = np.squeeze(scale_contour(path, 1 / 3, thetas))
1713        path_2_3 = np.squeeze(scale_contour(path, 2 / 3, thetas))
1714        path = np.squeeze(path)
1715
1716        dev_avg, dev_std, alpha_avg, alpha_std, _, alphas = get_phi_diff(path, phis, thetas, alpha_limit, origin == "upper")
1717        _, _, alpha_avg_1_3, alpha_std_1_3, _, alphas_1_3 = get_phi_diff(path_1_3, phis, thetas, alpha_limit, origin == "upper")
1718        _, _, alpha_avg_2_3, alpha_std_2_3, _, alphas_2_3 = get_phi_diff(path_2_3, phis, thetas, alpha_limit, origin == "upper")
1719
1720        mae = np.abs(alphas - alpha_avg).mean()
1721        sem = alpha_std / np.sqrt(len(alphas))
1722        chirality = np.pi / 2 if alpha_avg < np.pi else 3 * np.pi / 2
1723
1724        fake_news = np.ptp(alphas) >= np.pi if not show_anyway else False
1725
1726        candidate = alpha_std <= candidate_cutoff and not fake_news and is_contour_circular(path)
1727
1728        if thetas is not None:
1729            cx, cy = find_minimum_in_contour(path, thetas)
1730            cx -= xmin
1731            cy -= ymin
1732        else:
1733            cx, cy = int(box_xd / 2), int(box_yd / 2)
1734
1735        if alpha_avg < np.pi:
1736            cw += 1
1737        else:
1738            ccw += 1
1739
1740        all_contours[c_index] = {
1741            "path": path,
1742            "path_1_3": path_1_3,
1743            "path_2_3": path_2_3,
1744            "dev_avg": dev_avg,
1745            "dev_std": dev_std,
1746            "alpha_avg": alpha_avg,
1747            "alpha_std": alpha_std,
1748            "mae": mae,
1749            "sem": sem,
1750            "width_nm": width_nm,
1751            "height_nm": height_nm,
1752            "alphas": alphas,
1753            "alphas_1_3": alphas_1_3,
1754            "alpha_avg_1_3": alpha_avg_1_3,
1755            "alphas_2_3": alphas_2_3,
1756            "alpha_avg_2_3": alpha_avg_2_3,
1757            "winding_number": winding_number,
1758            "chirality": chirality,
1759            "cx": cx,
1760            "cy": cy,
1761            "xy_s": xy_s,
1762            "width": width,
1763            "height": height,
1764            "xmin": xmin,
1765            "xmax": xmax,
1766            "ymin": ymin,
1767            "ymax": ymax,
1768            "box_xd": box_xd,
1769            "box_yd": box_yd,
1770            "candidate": candidate,
1771        }
1772
1773        if candidate:
1774            candidates[c_index] = all_contours[c_index]
1775
1776        if not fake_news and (candidate or not just_candidates):
1777            displayed += 1
1778            contours_to_plot.append(c_index)
1779
1780        c_index += 1
1781
1782    number_of_plots = np.min((show_limit, c_index))
1783    spurious = f" ({number_of_plots - cw - ccw} spurious contours)" if number_of_plots - cw - ccw > 0 else ""
1784    print(f"Found {cw} clockwise and {ccw} anticlockwise contours{spurious}")
1785    
1786    if show_plot:
1787        show_circles_plot(
1788            displayed,
1789            all_contours,
1790            contours_to_plot,
1791            magnitudes,
1792            phis,
1793            thetas,
1794            scale,
1795            show=show,
1796            normalize=normalize,
1797            origin=origin,
1798            show_title=show_title,
1799            show_numbers=show_numbers,
1800            show_axes=show_axes,
1801            show_alphas=show_alphas,
1802            alpha_limit=alpha_limit,
1803        )
1804
1805    return candidates, all_contours
1806
1807
1808def show_circles_plot(
1809    displayed,
1810    all_contours,
1811    contours_to_plot,
1812    magnitudes,
1813    phis,
1814    thetas,
1815    scale,
1816    show="thetas",
1817    normalize=True,
1818    origin="upper",
1819    show_title=True,
1820    show_numbers=True,
1821    show_axes=True,
1822    show_alphas=True,
1823    alpha_limit=2 * np.pi,
1824):
1825    ncols = 4
1826    column_width = 6
1827    nrows = np.ceil(2 * displayed / ncols).astype(int)
1828    row, col = 0, 0
1829
1830    fig = plt.figure(figsize=(ncols * column_width, nrows * column_width))
1831    spec = gs.GridSpec(ncols=ncols, nrows=nrows, figure=fig)
1832
1833    for c_index in contours_to_plot:
1834        item = all_contours[c_index]
1835        path = item["path"]
1836        path_1_3 = item["path_1_3"]
1837        path_2_3 = item["path_2_3"]
1838        alphas = item["alphas"]
1839        alphas_1_3 = item["alphas_1_3"]
1840        alphas_2_3 = item["alphas_2_3"]
1841        dev_avg = item["dev_avg"]
1842        dev_std = item["dev_std"]
1843        alpha_avg = item["alpha_avg"]
1844        alpha_avg_1_3 = item["alpha_avg_1_3"]
1845        alpha_avg_2_3 = item["alpha_avg_2_3"]
1846        alpha_std = item["alpha_std"]
1847        candidate = item["candidate"]
1848
1849        xy_s = item["xy_s"]
1850        xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax = item["xmin"], item["xmax"], item["ymin"], item["ymax"]
1851        width, height = item["width"], item["height"]
1852        box_xd, box_yd = item["box_xd"], item["box_yd"]
1853        winding_number = item["winding_number"]
1854        chirality = item["chirality"]
1855        cx, cy = item["cx"], item["cy"]
1856        width_nm, height_nm = item["width_nm"], item["height_nm"]
1857
1858        # Set the underlying image and pick a color map
1859        m_subset = magnitudes[xy_s]
1860        p_subset = phis[xy_s]
1861        t_subset = thetas[xy_s]
1862
1863        im_to_show = p_subset if show == "phis" else t_subset
1864        cmap_to_show = ciecam02_cmap() if show == "phis" else cm.coolwarm_r
1865        cmap_max = 2 * np.pi if show == "phis" else np.pi
1866
1867        # Create a pair of (x, y) coordinates
1868        x = np.linspace(1, box_xd - 2, box_xd, dtype=np.uint8)
1869        y = np.linspace(1, box_yd - 2, box_yd, dtype=np.uint8)
1870        X, Y = np.meshgrid(x, y)
1871
1872        # Create vector lengths
1873        U = np.ones_like(m_subset) if normalize else m_subset * np.cos(p_subset) * np.sin(t_subset)
1874        V = np.ones_like(m_subset) if normalize else m_subset * np.sin(p_subset) * np.sin(t_subset)
1875
1876        # Create the axes
1877        ax = fig.add_subplot(spec[row, col])
1878        ax.autoscale()
1879        col += 1
1880
1881        # Show the feature and path
1882        ax.imshow(im_to_show, cmap=cmap_to_show, vmin=0, vmax=cmap_max, origin=origin)
1883        # m = get_contour_mask(path, m_1, xy_s)
1884        m = get_contour_mask(path, np.zeros_like(phis), xy_s)
1885        mask = np.ma.masked_where(m == 0, m) / 255 * chirality
1886        ax.imshow(mask, interpolation="none", alpha=0.7, origin=origin, vmin=0, vmax=2 * np.pi, cmap="plasma_r")
1887        ax.scatter(path_1_3[:, 0] - xmin + 1, path_1_3[:, 1] - ymin, color="yellow", alpha=0.3)
1888        ax.scatter(path_2_3[:, 0] - xmin + 1, path_2_3[:, 1] - ymin, color="green", alpha=0.3)
1889        ax.add_artist(ScaleBar(scale, box_alpha=0.8))
1890        ax.scatter(cx, cy, color="black")
1891
1892        title = (
1893            f"({xmin}, {ymin}) to ({xmax}, {ymax}), "
1894            f"{width_nm}x{height_nm} nm\n"
1895            rf"$\alpha:\ {alpha_avg:.2f},\ \sigma_{{\alpha}}:\ {alpha_std:.2f}\quad $"
1896            rf"$\phi_{{dev}}:\ {dev_avg:.2f},\ \sigma_{{dev}}:\ {dev_std:.2f}$"
1897        )
1898        if winding_number:
1899            title += rf"$\quad n: {winding_number:.2f}$"
1900
1901        ax.set_title(title if show_title else "")
1902
1903        # Place 4 dots to show the direction around the path
1904        colors = itertools.cycle(["red", "yellow", "green", "blue"])
1905        num_pts = len(path)
1906        pts = [
1907            path[0],
1908            path[int(num_pts / 4)],
1909            path[int(num_pts / 2)],
1910            path[int(3 * num_pts / 4)],
1911        ]
1912        for point in pts:
1913            ax.scatter(point[0] - xmin, point[1] - ymin, c=next(colors))
1914
1915        if show_numbers:
1916            c = "blue" if candidate else "red"
1917            label = rf"{c_index + 1}$\circlearrowright$" if alpha_avg < np.pi else rf"{c_index + 1}$\circlearrowleft$"
1918
1919            t = ax.text(
1920                0,
1921                0,
1922                label,
1923                fontdict={"fontsize": 20},
1924                c=c,
1925                horizontalalignment="left",
1926                verticalalignment="top",
1927            )
1928            t.set_bbox(dict(facecolor="white", alpha=0.8, edgecolor=c))
1929
1930        # Show the vectors
1931        ax.quiver(X, Y, U, V, angles=p_subset * 180 / np.pi, pivot="mid", units="dots")
1932
1933        # Turn axis labels on or off
1934        if show_axes:
1935            x_span, y_span = width // 5, height // 5
1936            ax.set_xticks(x[::x_span])
1937            ax.set_xticklabels((x + xmin - 1).astype(int)[::x_span])
1938            ax.set_yticks(y[::y_span])
1939            ax.set_yticklabels((y + ymin - 1).astype(int)[::y_span])
1940        else:
1941            ax.set_xticks([])
1942            ax.set_yticks([])
1943        #
1944        #
1945        # -----------------------------------
1946        #
1947        # Show alphas
1948        if show_alphas:
1949            num_alphas = len(alphas)
1950            xs = np.linspace(1, num_alphas + 1, num_alphas)
1951            xs_1 = np.linspace(1, num_alphas + 1, len(alphas_1_3))
1952            xs_2 = np.linspace(1, num_alphas + 1, len(alphas_2_3))
1953
1954            ax = fig.add_subplot(spec[row, col])
1955            ax.autoscale()
1956            col += 1
1957
1958            ax.plot(xs, alphas, ".", label=r"$\alpha$")
1959            ax.plot(xs_1, alphas_1_3, ".", label=r"$\alpha$ at $\frac{1}{3}$")
1960            ax.plot(xs_2, alphas_2_3, ".", label=r"$\alpha$ at $\frac{2}{3}$")
1961            ax.fill_between(xs, alphas + alpha_std, alphas - alpha_std, alpha=0.1)
1962            
1963            ax.axhline(np.pi, color="gray", ls="-", alpha=0.1)
1964            
1965            ax.axhline(alpha_avg, color="blue", ls="--", label=r"Avg $\alpha$", alpha=0.5)
1966            ax.axhline(
1967                alpha_avg_1_3,
1968                ls="--",
1969                color="yellow",
1970                label=r"Avg $\alpha$ at $\frac{1}{3}$",
1971            )
1972            ax.axhline(
1973                alpha_avg_2_3,
1974                ls="--",
1975                color="green",
1976                label=r"Avg $\alpha$ at $\frac{2}{3}$",
1977            )
1978            
1979            ax.set_ylim((0, alpha_limit))
1980            ax.set_xticks([])
1981            ax.set_yticks(np.linspace(0, alpha_limit, 5, endpoint=True))
1982            # ax.set_yticks([0, np.pi / 2, np.pi, 3 / 2 * np.pi, 2 * np.pi])
1983            ax.set_yticklabels(
1984                [
1985                    "0",
1986                    r"$\dfrac{\pi}{2}$",
1987                    r"$\pi$",
1988                    r"$\dfrac{3\pi}{2}$",
1989                    r"$2\pi$",
1990                ]
1991            )
1992
1993            ax.set_title(
1994                rf"$\alpha$: {alphas.min():.2f} to {alphas.max():.2f}, {alpha_avg:.2f} ({alpha_avg_2_3:.2f}, {alpha_avg_1_3:.2f}) average"
1995            )
1996            ax.legend(ncol=3)
1997
1998        if col == ncols:
1999            row += 1
2000            col = 0
2001
2002        # if show_both:
2003        #     p_m_subset = phis_m[xy_s]
2004
2005        #     ax = plt.subplot(num_rows, num_columns, 2 * index)
2006        #     ax.autoscale()
2007        #     ax.imshow(p_m_subset, cmap=ciecam02_cmap())
2008        #     ax.imshow(
2009        #         masked_circles[ymin:ymax, xmin:xmax],
2010        #         interpolation="none",
2011        #         alpha=alpha,
2012        #         cmap=cm.binary,
2013        #     )
2014        #     ax.add_artist(ScaleBar(scale, box_alpha=0.8))
2015
2016        #     if show_numbers:
2017        #         t = ax.text(
2018        #             0,
2019        #             0,
2020        #             index,
2021        #             fontdict={"fontsize": 20},
2022        #             c="black",
2023        #             horizontalalignment="left",
2024        #             verticalalignment="top",
2025        #         )
2026        #         t.set_bbox(dict(facecolor="white", alpha=0.8, edgecolor="black"))
2027
2028        #     ax.quiver(
2029        #         X,
2030        #         Y,
2031        #         U,
2032        #         V,
2033        #         units="dots",
2034        #         angles=p_subset * 180 / np.pi,
2035        #         color="white",
2036        #     )
2037
2038        #     ax.set_title(title)
2039        #     span = 5
2040        #     ax.set_xticks(x[::span])
2041        #     ax.set_xticklabels((x + xmin - 1).astype(int)[::span])

2046def show_contour_sizes(
2047    widths,
2048    heights,
2049    xerror,
2050    yerror,
2051    ltem_widths=None,
2052    ltem_heights=None,
2053    ltem_xerror=None,
2054    ltem_yerror=None,
2055):
2056    fig = plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
2057    ax = fig.add_subplot(111)
2058
2059    if len(widths) > 0:
2060        ax.errorbar(
2061            widths,
2062            heights,
2063            xerror,
2064            yerror,
2065            fmt=".",
2066            ms=6,
2067            label=f"SEMPA (avg: ({int(np.mean(widths))}, {int(np.mean(heights))}))",
2068        )
2069
2070    if ltem_widths is not None:
2071        ax.errorbar(
2072            ltem_widths,
2073            ltem_heights,
2074            ltem_xerror,
2075            ltem_yerror,
2076            fmt=".",
2077            ms=6,
2078            label=f"LTEM (avg: ({int(np.mean(ltem_widths))}, {int(np.mean(ltem_heights))}))",
2079        )
2080
2081    line = np.min((ax.get_xlim(), ax.get_ylim())), np.max((ax.get_xlim(), ax.get_ylim()))
2082    ax.plot(line, line, linestyle="dashed", alpha=0.3)
2083
2084    ax.set_aspect("equal")
2085    ax.set_xlabel("width [nm]")
2086    ax.set_ylabel("height [nm]")
2087    if ltem_widths is not None:
2088        plt.legend()
